title: 115_s62
content: The Act may be cited as the "January 8th National Memorial Act". The tragedy of January 8, 2011, at Congresswoman Gabrielle Gifford's ``Congress on Your Corner'' event resulted in the deaths of 6 people and injury of 13 others. This was the first time in the history of the United States. The assassination attempt on Congresswoman Gabrielle Giffords during a constituent meeting resulted in severe injuries to her and the deaths of 6 people, including Gabe Zimmerman, the first Congressional staffer to be assassinated in the line of duty. The Arizona community and people worldwide came together in the aftermath of the tragedy. After the assassination attempt on Congresswoman Gabrielle Giffords, Gabe Zimmerman became the first Congressional staffer to be assassinated in the line of duty. The Arizona community and people worldwide gathered at three memorial sites to provide comfort and support in the days following the tragedy. The Tucson January 8th Memorial will honor the victims of the tragedy and showcase the community's resilience and democracy's strength in the United States. The Tucson January 8th Memorial will honor the victims of the tragedy and showcase the community's resilience and democracy's strength in the United States. SEC. 3. JANUARY 8\TH\ NATIONAL MEMORIAL. The January 8th National Memorial, established by the Tucson's January 8th Memorial Foundation, is defined by key terms such as "Memorial," "Foundation," "Map," and "Secretary." The January 8th National Memorial, established by the Tucson's January 8th Memorial Foundation, is defined by key terms such as "Memorial," "Foundation," "Map," and "Secretary." The map titled "January 8 Memorial Site Map" and dated January 2016, and the Secretary of the Interior are also defined within the context. The Secretary is responsible for establishing the Memorial as an affiliated area of the National Park System once the Foundation complies with certain requirements. The Secretary will establish the Memorial as an affiliated area of the National Park System once the Foundation sets up a trust fund for receiving donations and managing the Memorial's construction and operation. The Foundation will establish a trust fund to receive donations and manage the construction, operation, maintenance, and management of the Memorial, which will be depicted by the "Memorial Boundary" on the map. The Foundation will also serve as the management entity responsible for the Memorial's administration. The Foundation will manage the construction, operation, maintenance, and management of the Memorial. The Memorial will cease to be part of the National Park System if the Foundation fails to comply with laws or maintain the required trust fund. The National Park Service will make the map of the Memorial available for public inspection. The Secretary can provide technical assistance and enter into cooperative agreements with the Foundation for financial assistance with marketing. The Secretary is not authorized to acquire property or use Federal funds for the Memorial. The Foundation provides financial assistance for marketing the Memorial. The Secretary is limited in their role and cannot use Federal funds for construction or management. A general management plan will be developed in consultation with the Foundation. The Foundation will develop a general management plan for the Memorial in accordance with the law. The plan must be submitted to the relevant committees within 3 years of funds being available or the Memorial's establishment. The Secretary must provide a copy of the completed general management plan to the relevant congressional committees within 3 years of funds being available or the Memorial's establishment.
